intro: Macropsychanthus lauterbachii subsp. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland regions with low rainfall.
